items.title: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
items.summary: CISA has added one new vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog, based on evidence of active exploitation. CVE-2025-55182 Meta React Server Components Remote Code Execution Vulnerability This type of vulnerability is a frequent attack vector for malicious cyber actors and poses significant risks to the federal enterprise. Binding Operational Directive (BOD) 22-01: Reducing the Significant Risk of Known Exploited Vulnerabilities established the KEV Catalog as a living li

items.title: Johnson Controls OpenBlue Mobile Web Application for OpenBlue Workplace
items.summary: View CSAF 1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY CVSS v4 6.5 ATTENTION: Exploitable remotely/low attack complexity Vendor: Johnson Controls Inc. Equipment: OpenBlue Mobile Web Application for OpenBlue Workplace Vulnerability: Direct Request ('Forced Browsing') 2. RISK EVALUATION Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to gain unauthorized access to sensitive information. 3. items.title: BRICKSTORM Backdoor
items.summary: Malware Analysis at a Glance Executive Summary The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), National Security Agency (NSA), and Canadian Centre for Cyber Security (Cyber Centre) assess People’s Republic of China (PRC) state-sponsored cyber actors are using BRICKSTORM malware for long-term persistence on victim systems. CISA, NSA, and Cyber Centre are releasing this Malware Analysis Report to share indicators of compromise (IOCs) and detection signatures based off analysis of eigh

items.title: CISA Releases Nine Industrial Control Systems Advisories
items.summary: CISA released nine Industrial Control Systems (ICS) Advisories. These advisories provide timely information about current security issues, vulnerabilities, and exploits surrounding ICS. ICSA-25-338-01 Mitsubishi Electric GX Works2 ICSA-25-338-02 MAXHUB Pivot ICSA-25-338-03 Johnson Controls OpenBlue Mobile Web Application for OpenBlue Workplace ICSA-25-338-04 Johnson Controls iSTAR ICSA-25-338-05 Sunbird DCIM dcTrack and Power IQ ICSA-25-338-06 SolisCloud Monitoring Platform ICSA-25-338-07 Advant

items.title: MAXHUB Pivot
items.summary: View CSAF 1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY CVSS v4 8.7 ATTENTION: Exploitable remotely/low attack complexity Vendor: MAXHUB Equipment: MAXHUB Pivot Vulnerability: Weak Password Recovery Mechanism for Forgotten Password 2. RISK EVALUATION Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to request a password reset and gain unauthorized access to the account. 3. items.title: Identifying Companies Affected by the Shai-Hulud NPM Supply Chain Attack | UpGuard
items.summary: Using Github event archives, UpGuard Research identifies companies with indicators of compromise of the Shai-Hulud attacks, even after the repos have been deleted.

items.title: Unclaimed Property: How an Unknown Entity Exposed Indian Banking Information | UpGuard
items.summary: UpGuard discovered a rapidly growing data leak of bank accounts in India– and no one to take responsibility for it.

items.title: Traffic Patterns: The Leakzone Part 2 | UpGuard
items.summary: UpGuard analyzes the universities, governments, and private companies mentioned in the access logs of hacker forum Leakzone.

items.title: Insufficient Coverage: WorkCycle, Langflow, and TPL | UpGuard
items.summary: UpGuard can now report that we have secured a Langflow instance leaking data for around 97,000 insurance customers in Pakistan.

items.title: The AggregateIQ Files, Part Four: Northwest Passage | UpGuard
items.summary: Learn more about how a data exposure from within Cambridge Analytica-linked firm AggregateIQ reveals web assets built for Canadian politicians and parties.

items.title: Aptly Named: How the Leakzone Exposed Access Logs | UpGuard
items.summary: UpGuard discovered an unauthenticated Elasticsearch database containing 22 million records of user traffic for hacking forum leakzone.net.

items.title: Black Box, Red Disk: How Top Secret NSA and Army Data Leaked Online | UpGuard
items.summary: A sensitive S3 bucket left wide open, containing highly classified 'NOFORN' data, was discovered by the UpGuard team.

items.title: Household Names: How Tetrad Exposed Data on 120 Million Consumers | UpGuard
items.summary: A collection of data sets detailing the purchasing habits and consumer behavior profiles of 120 million American households was exposed by Tetrad.

items.title: Clinical Trials: How Personal Information for Thousands of Australians was Exposed | UpGuard
items.summary: A company that matches individuals with clinical trials in Australia and New Zealand exposed personal information on over 37,000 people via a misconfigured MongoDB.
